sen.j: 種子島 時尭（たねがしま ときたか、1528年（享禄元年） － 1579年10月21日（天正7年10月2日 (旧暦)））は、島津氏の家臣で種子島の領主。
sen.e: Tokitaka TANEGASHIMA (1528 - October 21, 1579) was the vassal of the Shimazu clan and the feudal lord of Tanegashima Island.

sen.j: 種子島氏は南北朝時代 (日本)から島津氏に属し、時尭は種子島氏の第十四代領主（島主）。
sen.e: The Tanegashima clan belonged to the Shimazu clan since the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), and Tokitaka was the fourteenth feudal lord of the Tanegashima clan (the lord of the island).

sen.j: 1543年（天文 (元号)12年）、ポルトガル商人が乗った中国船が種子島に漂着。

sen.j: このとき、好奇心旺盛な時尭は、鉄砲の威力を見て即座に2000両の大金を支払い二挺を購入。
sen.e: On this occasion, curious Tokitaka saw the power of firearm and immediately spent 2000 ryo (currency unit) to buy two firearms.

sen.j: そして、鍛冶職人八板清定に命じて、鉄砲を分解させて調べさせ、鉄砲製造に成功する（もう一丁は島津氏を通して、征夷大将軍足利義晴に献上）。
sen.e: Then, he ordered Kiyosada YAITA, a smith, to disassemble the firearm to investigate and succeeded to manufacture the firearm (The other firearm was presented to Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA, seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") through the Shimazu clan).

sen.j: これに因んで、鉄砲は種子島銃とも呼ばれ、戦国時代 (日本)に大きな影響を及ぼす事になる。

sen.e: In addition, Madame Myoren, the daughter of Tokitaka and Takahisa's younger sister, married Yoshihisa SHIMAZU, Takahisa's heir, as the second wife.

sen.e: Tokitaka and his previously-mentioned wife were not fortunate to have any male child, so they secretly had a princess from the Nejime clan, who were fighting against the Shimazu clan in those times.
